Label: anchor
Scope Note: A recoil escapement used in clocks from about 1671. Devised in London and thought to have been invented by either Joseph Knibb or William Clement. It consists of an escape wheel with radially cut teeth operating in conjunction with a pair of pallets in the shape of an anchor - hense the name.

Label: massey lever
Scope Note: Types into detail: eg. type-1, type-2, etc.

Label: tic-tac
Scope Note: A type of recoil anchor escapement in which the pallets embrace only one and a half teeth of the escape wheel.

Label: unclassified
Scope Note: The term unclassified should not be used in its own right, it is simply a broad term.
